job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: great place to work and grow
cons: office is located in busy area

pros: Very mission driven and passionate colleagues. Gives you opportunities to network and do professional development
cons: Organization is bogged down by their own internal politics, both from the staff and lay leaders

pros: A nonprofit with funding, a goal of strategic decision-making, and a large organization to benefit from, which is not common in the nonprofit world
cons: It is a large company and an employee needs to advocate for their own growth trajectory. The opportunities exist, but they won't be handed out.

pros: Amazing enviornment to work at
cons: everything is good there thanks

pros:
The department and its members are great. Good comradery, etc. 
You get off the Jewish holidays (not chol hamoed, for those who are in the know) and most regular legal holidays, which is nice.
Work ends early on Fridays due to Shabbat.
cons:
Salary is extremely low, with none of the usual non-profit benefits.
Healthcare costs are INSANE, I pay an almost 10k annual premium just for myself+spouse, and the deductible is around 13k. They encourage 'eligible employees' to use the state exchange to try and get better rates.
They make you clock in and out, regardless of if you're salaried or PT, and are very anal about attendance.

pros: Great relationships with my colleagues
cons: Terrible health insurance and challenges with HR

pros: Warm environment nice people cute
cons: Bad pay young staff fun

review_title: Good place to make a difference
job_title: Director of Research in New York, NY
pros: Teamwork and mission are the most important positives of this org
cons: Focus and clarity are the largest organizational challenges

pros: Nice environment, people and organization
cons: no cons, great place to work

pros: Some of the junior employees are passionate about their work. Decent amount of days off between Jewish Calendar, holidays, PTO and sick time
cons:
Almost all of the leaders in it for themselves. Sad to see so much politics being played when the original mission was to serve the community. Because pay is low, most leaders are just trying to get a name for themselves and feed their ego outside of their job responsibilities, and are just not nice people to be around. 

Departments don't work with together, and people are scared to share information and projects across different teams as if they are scared someone else will steal it from them.

pros: this is a very good place to work
cons: there is no cons here

pros: In my case I have always worked with very nice and flexible people.
cons: The salary is not too competitive

pros: professional, understanding, empowering, overall really positive work environment
cons: very large office- hard to meet many people

pros: Does great work for the Jewish community including youth work, teen outreach, kosher food, advocacy for the developmentally disabled, and much, more work!
cons: Location is not great...downtown Manhattan

review_title: A great place to pass through
job_title: Program Associate in New York, NY
pros:
Very friendly, relaxed environment, great people

A lot of time off between personal vacation days and Jewish holidays

Beautiful location, right near the water, farmer's market, etc. 

Great opportunity to learn many aspects of non-profit so there are so many departments that each function completely differently.
cons:
There is not a lot of room to grow within the organization. There are a finite amount of positions and they do not add positions very often, so even if you excel in your position, you will have to wait it out until someone leaves their position.  Even then, you may not even be considered as a replacement. 

It's a great opportunity if you enter at a manager/director level and not a lot of potential to move anywhere if you are under that.

review_title: If you aren't realistic, you will be very frustrated
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Each division in and of itself is an amazing cause with genuine and talented individuals trying their best; secular and Jewish vacation days; 8 weeks paid maternity leave for women
cons: Negative work environment, nepotism, work/life balance very hard, little room for professional growth, very cliquey, lack of loyalty to employees and lack of "safe space" to critique supervisors, poor internal communications. You must remain committed to your ideals to find the work fulfilling or your spirit may get crushed.

job_title: Chief Operating Officer in New York, NY
pros: Although the OU is perhaps best known for the amazing work they do in Kosher supervision, the mission of the OU is far grander.  The revenues earned from Kosher supervision is reinvested back into extraordinary services that benefit the Orthodox Jewish community.  Some of the best known programs and services supported by the OU are NCSY, Yachad, JLIC (collegiate outreach), Synagogue Services, and IPA (political advocacy).
cons: The OU likes to think of itself as a sophisticated operation, but in truth they are very small minded and old school.  At present, and for the long-term foreseeable future, the OU will be micromanaged by a small group of lay leaders who call the shots and undervalue the contributions of their professional staff.  It is also a highly politicized environment where the senior professional staff and lay leadership often share a common interest in behaving unethically and with a minimum of integrity.

review_title: Stay far far away, no matter how enticing it may seem to join them
pros: Work life balance is decent, good amount of time off because of Jewish holidays and legal holidays, people you work with are nice. They provide Coffee and a bagel breakfast once a month - sometimes.
cons: Not much actually gets accomplished. Just a lot of meetings and no one will actually do their part in the needed follow up. They continue to employ people who are toxic to their own department and the organization as a whole and don't know left from right in their subject matter. Certain departments are understaffed while other departments have people who sit around doing crosswords, sudoku, Facebook or Youtube all day.  HR doesn't actually play a role in career development, or in hiring or lay offs. They just process the paperwork. The health benefits are atrocious.

review_title: ceo needs to go, employees are living of charity to feed their children
pros: good hours and more time off the other places
cons: employees are paid very low and most have to pay $1500 a month for health care for themselves and their family. The CEO (fagin) doesn't care and seem to think this place exists to get his name in the paper. Some of the long term employees have a special arrangement to get cheaper healthcare, of the rest, many are living off food banks and similar.  Pay raises are something like 1% a year every other year.  many of the employees are single women who are  paid even less than the rest

pros: I had a thoughtful and flexible manager who helped steer me through some of the tricky politics of the sprawling organization and introduced me to good colleagues. Many of the people you work with are good-natured and memorable colleagues.
cons:
Some of the unwritten benefits about time off or working out of the office are applied unequally across the different levels of the organization.
Internal competition for internal resources made many interactions political in nature.

pros: there is generous vacation time for Jewish holidays and leaving early Friday for Shabbat, company strives towards true positive change, excellent experience for collaborative work
cons: incredibly low growth potential for women, poor health insurance coverage, poor encouragement of work/life balance, high level of bureaucracy, professional judgement based on employees personal religious values

review_title: Bastion of nepotism and low standards and huge wage gaps between higher and lower employees
pros: generous vacation time  and extremely low pressure job
cons: glass ceiling, nepotism, lack of professionalism and professional development only exists for higher ups. Very low worker moral, also archaic working environment.

pros:
Many learning opportunities are present in the IT department of this job. Like many others, you have to put yourself out there and show the rest of the team you have what it takes, but it is very to do so in this friendly environment. 

The team wants to show you many things and help you grow.
cons: Compensation can be a bit low, but its great for entry to mid level careers

pros: Work/life balance is great - you rarely stay late unless it's for an event and the higher ups are fairly to very flexible with late arrivals/early leaving due to personal reasons. Vacation and sick time are both decent.
cons: Lots of infighting, some backstabbing, and nepotism. Hard to advance unless you have a family member who donated a lot of money or you are just really good at playing their game.

review_title: Excellent structure for a non-profit organization"
pros: Depending on the department you work in, employers are generally out to succeed and achieve set goals. This company is filled with opportunity, so if one is ambitious and has ideas, there is room to make them happen.
cons: As a non-profit, the work atmosphere is more relaxed, plenty of bureaucratic webs, and it is challenging to take a project from beginning to end. More problem solving skills are required.

review_title: Was great place for the time I was there; not a place to stay forever.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Good people trying to do good things.  Stable.  Significant autonomy and room for creativity.  Easy work-life balance most of the year.
cons: The usual un-professionalism associated with any not for profit.  Limited career growth opportunities.  Leadership sometimes keeps doing things the way they were, because that's the way they always have.

job_title: IT Support in New York, NY
pros: Maternity leave is semi generous, 8 weeks. No paternal leave.
cons: Terrible pay, no movement, no perks, terrible insurance options, many departments are favored over others

pros: Several days off as a result of Jewish holidays. Given a great deal of independence and latitude, some great managers.
cons: A ridiculous amount of turnover, especially in the upper management. With no managing director,  decisions take an inordinate amount to be made, and when issues arise between various departments there is no one to arbitrate and resolve these conflicts.

pros: You get a lot of vacation days due to the observance of the Jewish holidays.  Great place to work if you have a family since they can be flexible with time. Friendly people, laid back atmosphere.  Nice location right by the water downtown manhattan.
cons: No growth opportunities. Low salaries. Very poor management. Because of laid back atmosphere can be unprofessional.

review_title: Stay away unless its for the short term
pros: Great work-life balance if you follow the Jewish calendar
cons: Salary is less than doing the same job at other companies. Certain departments are understaffed while other departments have people who sit around surfing the web. Health benefits stink and are verrrrry expensive compared to other companies

review_title: Six of one, Half-Dozen of the Other
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Mostly good people to work with, very dedicated to the cause, great vacation time, decent salaries. A number of incredible causes each employee gets to work for.
cons: Extremely high healthcare premiums, internal communications can be improved.

review_title: pleasant place to work, not a place to stay long term
pros: friendly atmosphere, good benefits, lots of vacation due to observance of Jewish Holidays, flexible late arrivals/early leaving as long as time is made up
cons: There are no growth opportunities

job_title: Registration Associate in New York, NY
pros:
Great work-life balance, particularly if you follow the Jewish calendar and benefit from having those holidays off.
Great location.
Nice people at the organization.
cons:
Compensation wasn't as high as it should have been.
Some departments and staff were unprofessional and were unable to be professionalized.

pros: The OU is a great place to work if you are an observant Jew. They also updated their maternity leave policy, which makes it more favorable for family life.
cons: The pay is much less than my job position would be making at a different organization.

job_title: Director of Media Development in Cedarhurst, NY
pros: Good work environment, ability to see your work make a difference, everyone there is very passionate about what they do.
cons: low ceiling of growth, hesitancy to pay for anything, disorganized and sometimes highly unprofessional.

review_title: Working alongside great people for great Jewish causes.
job_title: Marketing Coordinator in New York, NY
pros:
- Friendly work environment
- Great, worthwhile cause(s)
- Off for all Jewish holidays
- Shortened work day on Friday
cons:
- Office politics

job_title: Systems Administrator in Jackson Heights, NY
pros: Atmosphere, Potential, Holidays, Family oriented and friendly
cons: Compensation is not industry standard at the moment for IT.

review_title: Great atmosphere and people. Highly recommend!
pros: Great people and worthy causes.
cons: The pay could be better, but most people working here aren't doing it for the money.

pros: positive work environment, vacation for all the Jewish holidays, friendly coworkers

pros: Amazing reach within community & financial resources.

pros: Great place to work, highly motivated and idealistic but also grounded
